Increased Productivity: If humans suddenly lost the ability to sleep, it would result in an increase in productivity as people would be able to work and be active 24/7. This could lead to a boost in economic growth and productivity levels.

Mental Health Issues: Lack of sleep can lead to mental health issues such as anxiety, depression, and irritability. Without sleep, people may become more susceptible to these issues, leading to a decline in mental health and well-being.

Increased Risk of Disease: Sleep is important for the body to repair and regenerate. Without sleep, the body may not be able to repair itself properly, leading to an increased risk of disease and illness.

Social Impact: Sleep is an important part of social interactions and relationships. Without sleep, people may become more irritable and less able to communicate effectively, leading to social conflicts and breakdowns.
Environmental Impact: Sleep is an important part of the natural world. Without sleep, ecosystems may become disrupted, leading to environmental issues such as pollution and deforestation.
